title: Looking for typography studios in London
content:
Hi there,

i’ve just graduated and i am looking for good typography studios (or graphic design studios with a strong typographic approach) to apply for an internship. As i say on the title located in London.  
Could you guys recommend me any?

Thanks!

 [‹ Kerning - difference between optical and metric?](http://web.archive.org/web/20080519014726/http:/www.typophile.com/node/20792 "Go to previous forum topic") [Falling into type habits ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080519014726/http:/www.typophile.com/node/20608 "Go to next forum topic")
author: dust

comments.content:
**Perhaps not yer cuppa, but if [Alan Kitching](http://web.archive.org/web/20080519014726/http:/www.rca.ac.uk/pages/research/alan_kitching_447.html) was having interns, his [Typography workshop](http://web.archive.org/web/20080519014726/http:/www.insideoutmagazine.co.uk/insideILiveLikeThis.html) could offer some hands-on experience I know I would die for.**

ƒ

Thanks for those Miguel and Fredo, they all look great, but i feel a bit scared! :)

Now, do you know any graphic design studios with a strong typographic approach or whose typography is remarkable??? i mean their use and application of type rather than their designed custom faces... (for that the posts from Miguel and Fredo are perfect)

I feel a bit intimidated by the typography studios, (i don’t know that much about type) i think i rather start in a graphic design studio where the expectations about my knowledge of type won’t be as high... Besides, i don’t know if i have that much to offer back in a studio where they strictly design type!!!

I’ll be waiting for your recommendations  
Thanks!
